Title: Prohibits involuntary employment of prisoners
Summary: Relates to prohibiting involuntary employment of prisoners; provides that no prisoner shall be compelled to provide labor against his or her will by actual force, threats of force, threats of punishment, threats of legal coercion or by any scheme, plan or pattern intended to cause the person to believe that, if such person did not provide such labor that such person or another person would suffer serious harm or physical restraint.
ActClause: Concurrent Resolution of the Senate and Assembly proposing an amendment to section 24 of article 3 of the constitution, in relation to prohibiting involuntary employment of prisoners
